solution_line_template: They already have {tubs_in_storage} tubs in storage, so they only need to buy {total_needed_tubs} needed tubs - {tubs_in_storage} tubs in storage = <<{total_needed_tubs}-{tubs_in_storage}={tubs_still_needed}>>{tubs_still_needed} tubs.
From the new vendor, they buy {tubs_still_needed} tubs / {new_vendor_divisor} = <<{tubs_still_needed}/{new_vendor_divisor}={tubs_from_new_vendor}>>{tubs_from_new_vendor} tubs.
They now have a total of {tubs_in_storage} + {tubs_from_new_vendor} = <<{tubs_in_storage}+{tubs_from_new_vendor}={tubs_after_new_vendor_purchase}>>{tubs_after_new_vendor_purchase} tubs.

They are therefore going to buy {total_needed_tubs} needed tubs - {tubs_after_new_vendor_purchase} owned tubs = <<{total_needed_tubs}-{tubs_after_new_vendor_purchase}={tubs_from_usual_vendor}>>{tubs_from_usual_vendor} tubs from the usual vendor.
